p: Getah virus (GETV; species Getah virus, genus Alphavirus, family Togaviridae) is an etiological agent of fever, rash, and leg edema in horses ( 226) and of fetal death and reproduction disorders in pigs ( 227, 228). The prevalence of GETV has been confirmed in mainland China, Japan, Korea, and Taiwan ( 229, 230). Outbreaks of GETV infection have occurred among Japanese racehorses ( 231, 232). It is known that GETV also infects cattle, although there is no evidence of illness in the infected cattle ( 226, 233, 234). However, cattle may contribute to a GETV endemic as a reservoir.
